pr_title: feat(griffin): distinct queries on symbol column retrieve the list fr…

timeline.message: feat(griffin): distinct queries on symbol column retrieve the list from metadata instead of iterating through the table.

timeline.bodyText: this factory does not need creating if condition below is met
timeline.author: bluestreak01

timeline.bodyText: reader is a shared resource - SQL code generator must not assign it to the factory, but close it instead in try() block.
timeline.author: bluestreak01

timeline.bodyText: this cursor should not need base factory
timeline.author: bluestreak01

timeline.bodyText: Reader must not be held by factory. This is a resource hungry instance, which are shared through the engine. Factory must hold on to the CairoEngine instance instead and table name.
timeline.author: bluestreak01

timeline.bodyText: it is better to pass column index
timeline.author: bluestreak01

timeline.bodyText: not sure why we need column filter?
timeline.author: bluestreak01

timeline.bodyText: when you have CairoEngine - this is the place to get reader
timeline.author: bluestreak01

timeline.bodyText: there is method Misc.free() that does something like this
timeline.author: bluestreak01

timeline.bodyText: we need one more test where symbol value is NULL
timeline.author: bluestreak01

timeline.message: feat(griffin): distinct queries on symbol column retrieve the list from metadata instead of iterating through the table.

timeline.bodyText: what is happening here? :) you already have column index
timeline.author: bluestreak01

timeline.bodyText: you shouldn't need to pass TableReader to record. Record needs SymbolMapReader
timeline.author: bluestreak01

timeline.bodyText:
we can avoid calling for every value of the result set
reader.getSymbolMapReader(columnIndex)
timeline.author: bluestreak01

timeline.bodyText: reader null check should not be necessary when Record is setup correctly. If reader is every to become null this should be reported where cursor is requested (don't think null is possible at all in this case)
timeline.author: bluestreak01

timeline.bodyText:
I would suggest making DistinctSymbolRecord non-static class. This way it can access symbol map reader on factory instance and only have its own record index.
This said, recordB is better be created lazily. It is only used when someone is ordering symbols returned by this cursor. Which is not very often.
timeline.author: bluestreak01

timeline.bodyText: spelling disticntSymbolMetadata
timeline.author: bluestreak01
bluestreak01

timeline.bodyText: factory must close its cursor (which is closeable)
timeline.author: bluestreak01

timeline.bodyText: minor: toTop() and record.reset() implement the same logic, perhaps topTop() can call recordA.reset(). Or may be record.reset() could be renamed to record.toTop()
timeline.author: bluestreak01

timeline.message: feat(griffin): distinct queries on symbol column retrieve the list from metadata instead of iterating through the table.

timeline.bodyText: Can we pull this value up StaticSymbolTable interface level? The idea of static symbol table is that it is bounded, e.g. knows of its size and presumably that it knows that it has null?
timeline.author: bluestreak01

timeline.bodyText: this write should be cached i feel like, e.g. read of class member is faster than write to memory mapped file
timeline.author: bluestreak01

replies.bodyText: yes, working on that, just wanted to push the latest changes
replies.author: jaugsburger

timeline.bodyText: I don't follow this condition. Why are we comparing int value of symbol to size of symbol map?
timeline.author: bluestreak01

replies.bodyText: the reason is that the symboMapReader.size() still returns the number of symbols without counting the null value. on the other hand, record.hasNext() now returns true one final time if the symbolMapReader contains a null symbol
replies.author: jaugsburger
